meaning.reversed: It's not fair, I can't answer

careerSpread.summaryText: With the tender guidance of the cards, see opportunities in career travel, soften obstacles and take clear steps.

problemSolvingSpread.summaryText: With the tender guidance of the cards, analyze the problem with calm and explore practical solutions.

situationAnalysisSpread.summaryText: With the tender guidance of the cards, see the present situation, hear the inner voice, and plan your next step with confidence.

blog.title: Tarot Card Guide
blog.subtitle: Explore the deeper meanings of each card
blog.description: Travel in the mysterious world of tarot cards, comments on the flat and inverse meanings of each card, love, career, money, and spiritual guidance.

the-fool.name: Crazy ▪ Passenger of Infinity Possibilities
the-fool.short_description: Crazy is the card of new beginnings, pure potential, and stepping into the unknown.

upright.general: Crazy represents the beginning of the journey of life, notice your potential, your curiosity, your courage, new experiences, new learning opportunities.
upright.love: In love, crazy represents fresh beginnings and spontaneous emotions, a new relationship or a resuscitation in a current relationship.
upright.career: On the way to career, you have the courage to start creative projects and get out of your comfort zone, take risks and try new ways.
upright.money: In financial matters, it's important to intuitively assess opportunities, and small risks can lead to great gains, so don't forget to be careful.
upright.spiritual: Spiritually, Mad is the card of inner discovery and awareness, trust in your intuition, and consider every experience an opportunity to learn.

reversed.general: Reverse Crazy is a warning of recklessness and planlessness, and rash decisions can block your potential, so be planned and conscious.
reversed.love: It points to indecision in love and lack of communication, clarify your feelings, and keep intimacy at the forefront.
reversed.career: In projects, impregnation or hasty steps can pose a risk.
reversed.money: There's a risk of financial failures and losses.
reversed.spiritual: You may have lost your way spiritually, return to your inner guidance and trust your intuition.

context.mythology: The mad carries the universal passenger and the symbol of zero. In mythology, travel and transformation begins with the hero's step into the unknown. Hermes and Trickster's energy represents the freedom and curiosity of Madman.

celtic_cross.future: In the future, you will be open to new experiences and surprises that will offer unexpected ways of learning and growing opportunities.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: Secret influences, pureness and courage, shape things and people around you, and guidances that you don't realize are in effect.

story.title: The Inner Journey of the Mad
story.description: The madman stops at the beginning of the path of life; he has nothing but trust and curiosity; his inner guidance is gradually guided; every experience gives courage, learning, and growth.
story.history_message: The madman is placed in the Tarot sequence with number 0, representing the zero potential, space and beginning, depicting the madness as a symbol of travel and learning in the Middle Ages and Renaissance cards.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Message - Take a Fearless Step
story.mystic_message: The madman invites you to open your heart and your mind, every step is an intention, every experience is a learning, go without fear, the unknown will make you mature.
story.cultural_message: In modern times, it represents the crazy, inner healer, the brave entrepreneur, and the person who dances with the surprises of life.
story.lesson: It teaches you to explore your potential with madness and courage and curiosity, and the journey is more learning and progress than the destination.

keywords.keywords_message: Insane tarot meaning, the fool tarot, the tarot, new beginning, tarot courage, tarot potential, tarot journey
keywords.positive_message: New beginnings, pure potential, courage, curiosity, learning and internal discovery.
keywords.balance_message: Avoid carelessness, act with intuition and awareness instead of hasty steps.
keywords.soul_message: Each step is an opportunity to learn, listen to the guidance within, and take a safe step into the unknown.

associations.title: Cosmic Connections to the Mad Card

0.meaning: When combined with the gift of the pure potential Wizard, ideas are quickly applied.

1.meaning: Intuition and internal guidance make the journey of the madman safe and meaningful.

2.meaning: New beginnings can turn into happiness and success; positive developments can occur.

affirmation_list.0: My heart and mind are clear, I'm stepping into the unknown.
affirmation_list.1: Every experience is an opportunity for me to grow up.
affirmation_list.2: I'm progressing under the guidance of the healer in me.

cta.main: Expose your courage and take the first step!
cta.micro: Take a small step today: an idea, an initiative or a new experience.

0.question: What does the mad card represent?
0.answer: It represents new beginnings, pure potential, courage, and my name to the unknown, and it's time to rely on inner guidance.

1.question: Why does the crazy card matter?
1.answer: This card reminds you of the beginning of the journey, of growing up through learning and experience, and trust your potential and step forward.

2.question: What does Reverse-Crazy show?
2.answer: It stimulates inverse positions, recklessness, rash decisions, or irresponsible behavior.

the-magician.name: Magician Power and Master will, where intent is materialized
the-magician.short_description: The wizard is a symbol of the art of using willpower, skill, and resources consciously, representing his mastery of transforming intent into exposition with the four elements he has (the staff, the glass, the sword, the pentagram).

upright.general: When the wizard comes steep, you're in a time when internal resources and means of the outside world come together expertly. With wills, focus and abilities, you can turn your dreams into solids. This card reminds you to recognize your creative power, to make your intentions clear and step forward. You have the energy and skill to turn ideas into actions. Now it's time to organize them.
upright.love: In love, the Wizard represents communication, attraction, and intentional interactions. You're entering an impressive period; you have the power to influence the other person, to shape the dynamics of the relationship with consciousness. If you're starting a new relationship, express yourself openly and decisively; creative solutions and sincere rhetoric will emerge in the existing relationship.
upright.career: The Wizard in terms of careers brings up skills, entrepreneurial and persuasive skills. Presentations are a good time for projects and new initiatives. Use resources effectively, activate the network, and turn your ideas into concrete plans. When technical skill meets charisma, progress speeds up.
upright.money: In material matters, the Wizard shows the capacity to find strategic use and creative income routes. You can use your resources in the right place, but with small but effective investments, the intention must be clear; instead of following every opportunity, be selective and planned.
upright.spiritual: At a spiritual level, the Wizard is associated with energy studies, intentional rituals and concreteization practice, strengthen his intentions with meditations, align energy centers and accelerate internal transformation through symbols. When you combine will with internal knowledge, your spiritual skills become practice.

reversed.general: The Reverse Wizard points to the lack of full use of abilities, distractions or manipulative intentions. Don't let potential go to waste; lack of planning, lack of self-esteem or the tendency to manipulate others can be a problem. Reevaluate your intentions and check the ethics of your actions.
reversed.love: In reverse positions in love indicate the risk of deception, overcontrolling behavior or insincere communication, and it takes intimacy and clarity to ensure that the desire to influence does not cause instability in the relationship.
reversed.career: A reverse Wizard in a career can mean loss of reputation or failure projects due to show-off or superficial approaches. Start projects in a hurry; first make sure there's enough skills and support.
reversed.money: Financially, inverse position, misinvestment decisions are threatened by false promises or inefficient use of the source. Apply a realistic plan and validation processes.
reversed.spiritual: On a spiritual level, the reverse Wizard is related to spiritual ego or "short search." Avoid displayive practices instead of real practice and discipline; seek humble learning and guidance.

context.mythology: The wizard is closely related to the Hermes/Mercury archetype: communication, skill, deception and experience. The four tools in his hand represent four elements (the staff, the glass, the sword, the pentagram) and all the resources available in the physical world. Similar figures in mythology are seen as the tools that download divine messages to the world.

celtic_cross.future: If the Wizard appears in the future, you have a good chance to start something by using your abilities, and when you support your plans with intent, the means and persons will appear before you.
celtic_cross.hidden_influences: In the field of hidden influences, the skills you possess or the support of someone in your inner circle may affect your decisions. Don't underestimate your own power; adapt with external resources.

story.title: The Story of the Card: Master of the Four Unsorts on the Table
story.description: The wizard stands behind a table; in front of it lies a wand, a glass, a sword, and a pentagram. These objects symbolize the material in his hand and the capacity to transform the world. One hand reaches up to the sky and the other to the ground. He sets a bridge: he turns ideas into action, intent into reality.
story.historytitle: Historical Origin: First Master and Symbolic Tools
story.history_message: In history, the Wizard figure appears in a variety of mastery traditions, from alchemists to pundits. During the Renaissance, the Wizard painting refers to the capacity to shape man's own destiny. The tools in symbolism represent both internal and external resources: mental skill, emotional balance, mental clarity and material resources.
story.mystic_title: Spiritual Meaning: The Power of Entrance
story.mystic_message: Spiritually, the Wizard teaches the importance of working with the harmony of intent and self, you can transform your inner strength into concrete results with will, focus and discipline, spiritual practice, intentional work, and energy manipulation techniques form the spiritual practice of this card.
